name: Tesofensine
overview: A serotonin-noradrenaline-dopamine reuptake inhibitor initially developed for Alzheimer's and Parkinson's disease. Clinical trials revealed significant weight loss effects, shifting research focus to obesity treatment.
who_should_avoid: concurrent use of MAO inhibitors or other psychiatric medications
interactions_notes: CRITICAL: Significant interaction risk with antidepressants (SSRIs, SNRIs), MAO inhibitors, stimulants, and blood pressure medications. Can cause serotonin syndrome. Comprehensive psychiatric and cardiovascular evaluation mandatory before use.
dosing_ranges_literature: Clinical trials for obesity explored doses of 0.25-1 mg per day orally. The 0.5 mg dose showed optimal efficacy-to-safety ratio in phase 2 trials. Not approved for use in most countries.
storage_notes: Store in cool, dry place away from light. Follow specific product storage instructions as this is typically an oral compound.

references.title: Tesofensine for obesity treatment
references.note: Phase 2 clinical trial data on tesofensine for weight loss.

references.title: Triple monoamine reuptake inhibitors in weight management
references.note: Overview of tesofensine's mechanism and efficacy in obesity.
